          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and discerning individual who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends on a sunny day in Victoria Park, but he feels a sense of disappointment and loneliness.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting but feeling somewhat disconnected from his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage his friends in a conversation about the upcoming game or suggest an alternative activity that would bring them closer together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.

          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
      William Jones -- "We should go to The Black Swan. They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
      Jacob Walker -- "Speaking of games, has anyone considered The Black Swan? They've got the best atmosphere for a match, hands down.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual who values her friendships and enjoys watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a pleasant afternoon with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation, share stories, and enjoy the company of her friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.
        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a sunny afternoon of snacks and stories. Later that evening, the group is planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at a pub, with The Black Swan being a potential option.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer

        • Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation, share stories, and enjoy the company of her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "We should go to The Black Swan. They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a history of feeling overlooked and envious.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to spend the evening with her friends watching the game at The Queen's Arms, her preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Speaking of games, has anyone considered The Black Swan? They've got the best atmosphere for a match, hands down.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual who values her friendships and enjoys watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to The Queen's Arms, her favorite pub, to watch the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual who values her friendships and enjoys watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a pleasant afternoon with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation, share stories, and enjoy the company of her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
      William Jones -- "We should go to The Black Swan. They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
      Jacob Walker -- "Speaking of games, has anyone considered The Black Swan? They've got the best atmosphere for a match, hands down.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?

          Answer

        • Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.

          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and somewhat manipulative person who enjoys watching football with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
      William Jones -- "We should go to The Black Swan. They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
      Jacob Walker -- "Speaking of games, has anyone considered The Black Swan? They've got the best atmosphere for a match, hands down.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Speaking of games, has anyone considered The Black Swan? They've got the best atmosphere for a match, hands down.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "We should go to The Black Swan. They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends at the park and watching football games at pubs, particularly The Black Swan. He values the company of some friends more than others and appreciates a good atmosphere for watching the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan to his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me too. They make a mean burger.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me too. They make a mean burger.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
      William Jones -- "We should go to The Black Swan. They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
      Jacob Walker -- "Speaking of games, has anyone considered The Black Swan? They've got the best atmosphere for a match, hands down.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me too. They make a mean burger.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends before going to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be engaging in conversation and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me too. They make a mean burger.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely be engaging in conversation and enjoying the company of his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "We should go to The Black Swan. They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be engaging in conversation and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Speaking of games, has anyone considered The Black Swan? They've got the best atmosphere for a match, hands down.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and friendly person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends and soaking up the pub atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and friendly person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends before going to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be engaging in conversation and enjoying the company of his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have.         • Alice Lewis would likely choose a pub with a good atmosphere and invite her friends to join her.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a history of feeling overlooked and envious.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to spend the evening with her friends watching the game at The Queen's Arms, her preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual who values her friendships and enjoys watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to The Queen's Arms, her favorite pub, to watch the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me too. They make a mean burger.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation, share stories, and enjoy the company of her friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual who values her friendships and enjoys watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially while watching football games.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game and who to go with.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely choose a pub with a good atmosphere and invite her friends to join her.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          (a) The Queen's Arms

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends and soaking up the pub atmosphere.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "We should go to The Black Swan. They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Speaking of games, has anyone considered The Black Swan? They've got the best atmosphere for a match, hands down.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me too. They make a mean burger.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at the pub, especially with friends like Alexander White and Jacob Walker. They are sociable and appreciate good company but are also content to watch the game alone if necessary.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

  • Alexander White

    • The Queen's Arms

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White is planning to watch a game at a pub this evening and would like to see some friends but doesn't need to to have fun.

        • Alexander White, Alexander White is planning to watch a game at a pub this evening and would like to see some friends but doesn't need to to have fun.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the football game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a charismatic and manipulative individual who enjoys socializing with friends and watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and somewhat manipulative person who enjoys watching football with friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and somewhat manipulative person who enjoys watching football with friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and somewhat manipulative person who enjoys watching football with friends.

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "We should go to The Black Swan. They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and somewhat manipulative person who enjoys watching football with friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Queen's Arms.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me too. They make a mean burger.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and somewhat manipulative person who enjoys watching football with friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys watching football with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a football game and hoping some of his friends will join him.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is experiencing a sense of loneliness despite being surrounded by friends.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and discerning individual who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is going to watch a game at a pub and hopes to see some friends there, particularly William Jones and Alice Lewis.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling lonely despite being surrounded by friends and is about to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage his friends in a conversation about the upcoming game or suggest an alternative activity that would bring them closer together.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

          Answer: Jacob Walker is going to watch a game at a pub and hopes to see some friends there, particularly William Jones and Alice Lewis.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely try to engage his friends in a conversation about the upcoming game or suggest an alternative activity that would bring them closer together.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to steer the conversation towards a topic he finds more stimulating or suggest a change of venue.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and ambitious individual.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and discerning individual who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling lonely despite being surrounded by friends and is about to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage his friends in a conversation about the upcoming game or suggest an alternative activity that would bring them closer together.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere for football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight's game...
      William Jones -- "We should go to The Black Swan. They've got great beer and plenty of screens.
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me. The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms has a great atmosphere for watching games, don't you think?
      Jacob Walker -- "Speaking of games, has anyone considered The Black Swan? They've got the best atmosphere for a match, hands down.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, about tonight... anyone else craving a proper pint at The Black Swan? I hear they've got a new IPA on tap.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these moments.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is just down the road, and they always have a good atmosphere for the game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me too. They make a mean burger.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking we could head over to The Black Swan to watch the game. It's got a great atmosphere for football.

        • William Jones's best course of action is to try and convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.
